alert.note: Alert for Spencer (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Indiana, including the following county, Spencer. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 551 PM CDT, emergency management roads across northern Spencer County were flooded due to heavy rainfall. While the heavy rain has ended, it will take additional time for flooded creeks and streams to recede. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Pigeon Creek, Hurricane Creek, Blackhawk Creek, Hunley Creek, Crooked Creek, Anderson River, North Fork Little Pigeon Creek and Buckhorn Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dale and Santa Claus.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
